Snowflake: Cloud-based data warehousing service for structured and semi-structured data
Databricks: Databricks Lakehouse: harmonizes data lake and warehouse
CockroachDB: Open source; cloud-native distributed SQL database.
TiDB: Distributed SQL database that supports HTAP workloads
SingleStore: Distributed RDBMS that combines an in-memory row-oriented and a disc-based column-oriented storage
DuckDB: An embeddable; in-process; column-oriented SQL OLAP RDBMS

MySQL: ADO.NET; JDBC; ODBC; Proprietary native API
SQL server: ADO.NET; JDBC; ODBC; OLE DB; Tabular Data Stream (TDS)
PostgreSQL: ADO.NET; JDBC; native C library; ODBC; streaming API for large objects
Clickhouse: HTTP; REST; JDBC; ODBC; Proprietary protocol
TiDB: GORM; JDBC; ODBC; Proprietary protocol; SQLAlchemy
SingleStore: Cluster Management API; info HTTP API; JDBC; MongoDB API; ODBC

description:
The planner is responsible for taking the tokens extracted from the query string by the Parser; and converting them into a Logical Query Plan
[URL#1](https://planetscale.com/blog/what-is-a-query-planner); [URL#2](https://blog.mireo.com/from-a-string-to-the-thing-parsing-and-planning-sql-queries-with-apache-calcite-part-1)

PostgreSQL:
Process per DBMS worker [1](https://dsf.berkeley.edu/papers/fntdb07-architecture.pdf)
[Discussions about moving to single-process; multi-threaded architecture](https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/31cc6df9-53fe-3cd9-af5b-ac0d801163f4%40iki.fi)

Oracle: Row store + optional in-memory column store

Yugabyte: [DocDB (responsible for transactions; sharding; replication and storage (custom RocksDB engine))](https://docs.yugabyte.com/preview/architecture/layered-architecture/)

SQL server: B-tree; Clustered; Non-clustered; XML; Spatial; Filtered; Full-text; Columnstore; JSON; Hash
Databricks: B-tree; Bitmap; Bloom; Delta; Geospatial; Z-order
Yugabyte: B-tree; Hash; Range; JSONB; JSONPath; Full-text; GIN; Time-Series; Bloom
TiDB: B-tree; Hash; Clustered; Non-clustered; Full-text; Spatial; JSON; Unique; Bitmap; Time-Series
DuckDB: B-tree; ART; BitWeaving; Bitmap; Min-Max; Z-order; R-tree; Inverted Lists

description: The transaction manager manages all currently open transactions; and is in charge of handling COMMIT or ROLLBACK commands.
